com.actinarium.rhythm

Interface ArgumentsBundle

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    MagicVariablesArgumentsBundle, SimpleArgumentsBundle

    public interface ArgumentsBundle
    An interface that defines an arguments container that will be used by RhythmSpecLayerFactory implementations to query spec layer properties when creating new layers.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static interface  ArgumentsBundle.DimensionUnits
      Type definition for dimension argument units
      static interface  ArgumentsBundle.EdgeAffinity
      Type definition for screen edge that a keyline or pattern must be attached to.

        Test if there's an argument with given key in the bundle, even if the value is null.
        Parameters:
        key - argument key
        Returns:
        true if argument is present regardless of value

      • getGravity

        int getGravity(java.lang.String key,
               int defaultValue)
        Get argument value as a gravity value (a combination of Gravity constants) with fallback to default value if argument is missing.
        Parameters:
        key - argument key
        defaultValue - fallback value
        Returns:
        gravity constant
        See Also:
        getEdgeAffinity(String, int)

      • getEdgeAffinity

        int getEdgeAffinity(java.lang.String key,
                    int defaultValue)
        Get argument as an ArgumentsBundle.EdgeAffinity constant, which can be either Gravity.TOP, Gravity.LEFT, Gravity.RIGHT, or Gravity.BOTTOM, with fallback to default value if argument is missing or invalid.
        Parameters:
        key - argument key
        defaultValue - fallback value
        Returns:
        gravity constant
        See Also:
        getGravity(String, int)

      • getDimensionUnits

        int getDimensionUnits(java.lang.String key)
        Get the units of a dimension argument.
        Parameters:
        key - argument key
        Returns:
        dimension argument units, or UNITS_NULL if the argument is null or missing

      • getDimensionValue

        float getDimensionValue(java.lang.String key,
                        float defaultValue)
        Get raw numeric value from dimension argument disregarding units and NOT performing any conversion to pixels.
        Parameters:
        key - argument key
        defaultValue - fallback value in pixels
        Returns:
        dimension argument raw value
        See Also:
        getDimensionPixelSize(String, int), getDimensionPixelOffset(String, int)

      • getDimensionPixelExact

        float getDimensionPixelExact(java.lang.String key,
                             float defaultValue)
        Get dimension argument value as pixels with possible fallback to default value if argument is missing or invalid. Unlike getDimensionPixelSize(String, int) and getDimensionPixelSize(String, int), this method doesn't perform any rounding.
        Parameters:
        key - argument key
        defaultValue - fallback value in pixels
        Returns:
        argument value converted to pixels
        See Also:
        getDimensionPixelSize(String, int), getDimensionPixelOffset(String, int)

      • getDimensionPixelOffset

        int getDimensionPixelOffset(java.lang.String key,
                            int defaultValue)
        Get dimension argument value as pixels with possible fallback to default value if argument is missing or invalid. Unlike getDimensionPixelSize(String, int), this method is expected to round the raw value down to the closest integer.
        Parameters:
        key - argument key
        defaultValue - fallback value in pixels
        Returns:
        argument value converted to pixels
        See Also:
        getDimensionPixelSize(String, int), getDimensionPixelExact(String, float)

      • getDimensionPixelSize

        int getDimensionPixelSize(java.lang.String key,
                          int defaultValue)
        Get dimension argument value as pixels with possible fallback to default value if argument is missing or invalid. Unlike getDimensionPixelOffset(String, int)}, this method is expected to round the raw value up or down to the closest integer by common rules, and must ensure the result is at least 1px if original value is not 0.
        Parameters:
        key - argument key
        defaultValue - fallback value in pixels
        Returns:
        argument value converted to pixels
        See Also:
        getDimensionPixelOffset(String, int), getDimensionPixelExact(String, float)

      • getDisplayMetrics

        android.util.DisplayMetrics getDisplayMetrics()
        Get display metrics associated with this arguments bundle.
        Returns:
        display metrics object
